ygData.msgSnippet: Is it an average rate of 0KB/sec (but perhaps still a trickle of completed URIs), or no progress at all (nothing new appearing as finished in crawl.log)? Check

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix 3 spends most of its time in Candidates
 postprocessor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=FS7DO6IAOvuTZr6jqWfv71xfqBX0sWjhm3Am8P3J0MZu
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Is it an average rate of 0KB/sec (but perhaps still a trickle of 
completed URIs), or no progress at all (nothing new appearing as 
finished in crawl.log)?

Check the logs (especially 'alerts' and 'heritrix_out') for any errors 
that might explain a total freeze.

The CandidatesProcessor runs the entire 'CandidatesChain' of processors 
that process each outlink (candidate URI), and ends with URIs being 
enqueued into the frontier. To narrow down what might be happening it 
would help to see a few more representative stacks of exactly where 
multiple threads are held up -- from either the 'Threads Report' or 
Java's 'jstack' or -SIGQUIT stack dumping.

If those steps yield nothing obvious, knowing the OS and JVM version 
could eventually become relevant.

- Gordon

On 9/20/12 5:13 AM, matteo.ceccarello@... wrote:
> Hi all, I'm doing some test to tweak the configuration of Heritrix 3.
> The final goal is to make a large crawl (namely the entire .it
> domain).
>
> The setup I'm using for the test is a single machine with 12Gb of
> RAM, 1Tb hard disk and 8 cores.
>
> Heritrix is configured with the default values, except that the
> UriUniqFilter is BloomUriUniqFilter.
>
> I've noticed that after a short time (more or less 3 hours) the crawl
> speed drops from 3000 KB/sec (reported by the Heritrix web interface)
> to 0. At the same time all threads are in the Candidates processor,
> and they seem stuck there.
>
> What can be the cause of this behaviour?
>
> Thank you very much for you advices!
>
> Matteo
>
